column5: Looking for recommendations for a hand held GPS for a Canadian trip. Just want something to mark waypoints of mid lake structure, as well as to navigate my wayback if I'm ever on a large lake with lots of islands.

It's funny you should say lot's of islands,the 1st year we went to Canada we had a map on our lap most of time,around this island that island,AHH CRAP! and we were not that far from camp.2nd yr.bought myself a Lowrance H20c and could not be happier.we now take our own boat with gps,but I still use the H20c when we go ice fishing great tool but i'm sure them don't make them any more.

I use a Garmin eTrex Legend HCx. I added the lake deoth maps, which can get expensive. Great little unit. Not sure if this model is discontinued or not, but the units themselves are fairly cheap now.My friend has a Lowrance iFinder H20c that he uses without any additional maps. Works great for tracking and marking waypoints.Without purchasing extra maps, I think the H20 unit is better. As mentioned, it is discontinued and I am not sure if the newer models compare well with it or not though.The Garmin GPSMAP 76Cx is often recommended by a lot of folks as well.
